lightly adverb
(NOT MUCH)
to only a small degree: Bake the cookies for 6-8 minutes, or until lightly browned. Online gambling is only lightly regulated. Wine labelled "frizzante" is lightly sparkling.
C1 If food is lightly cooked, it is cooked for only a short time: lightly cooked vegetables I like eggs lightly cooked so that the yolk is still runny.

lightly adverb
(NOT SERIOUSLY)
If you say something lightly, you are not serious when you say it: "Anyway, it won't affect me because I'm leaving," she said lightly. not do something lightly
C2 If something is not said or treated lightly, it is said or treated in a serious way, after great thought: Accusations like these from a top minister are not made lightly.
